statements.name: PROC LOGISTIC
statements.description: uses logistic regression to investigate the relationship between discrete response variables and a set of explanatory variables.
statements.help:
PROC LOGISTIC <options>;                 
	BY  variables;                 
	CLASS  variable <(options)>...<variable <(options)>></ global-options>;                 
	CODE <options>;                 
	CONTRAST  'label' row-description<,..., row-description></ options>;                 
	EFFECT  name=effect-type (variables </ options>);                 
	EFFECTPLOT <plot-type<(plot-definition-options)>></ options>;                 
	ESTIMATE <'label'> estimate-specification <(divisor=n)><,...<'label'> estimate-specification <(divisor=n)>></ options>;                 
	EXACT <'label'><INTERCEPT><effects></ options>;                 
	EXACTOPTIONS options;                 
	FREQ  variable;                 
	ID  variable <variable...>;                 
	LSMEANS <model-effects></ options>;                 
	LSMESTIMATE  model-effect <'label'> values <divisor=n><,...<'label'> values <divisor=n>></ options>;                 
	MARGINS  model-effects </ options>;                 
	<label:>MODEL  variable<(variable_options)> = <effects></ options>;                 
	NLOPTIONS <options>;                 
	ODDSRATIO <'label'> variable </ options>;                 
	OUTPUT <OUT=SAS-data-set><keyword-options> / <option>;                 
	ROC <'label'><specification></ options>;                 
	ROCCONTRAST <'label'><contrast></ options>;                 
	SCORE <options>;                 
	SLICE  model-effect </ options>;                 
	STORE <OUT=>item-store-name</ LABEL='label'>;                 
	STRATA  variable <(option)>...<variable <(option)>></ options>;                 
	<label:>TEST  equation1 <, equation2,...></ option>;                 
	UNITS <independent1=list1 | (numlist1) <*SD>><independent2=list2 | (numlist2) <*SD>>...</ option>;                 
	WEIGHT  variable </ option>;

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the level of significance α for 100(1-α)% confidence intervals

arguments.name: COVOUT
arguments.description: adds the estimated covariance matrix to the OUTEST= data set

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the SAS data set containing the data to be analyzed

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: reverses the sort order for the levels of the response variable

arguments.name: EXACTONLY
arguments.description: requests only the exact analyses

arguments.name: EXACTOPTIONS
arguments.description: specifies options that apply to every EXACT statement in the program

arguments.name: ABSFCONV=
arguments.description: Specifies the absolute function convergence criterion

arguments.name: ADDTOBS
arguments.description: Adds the observed sufficient statistic to the sampled exact distribution

arguments.name: BUILDSUBSETS
arguments.description: Builds every distribution for sampling

arguments.name: EPSILON=
arguments.description: Specifies the comparison fuzz for partial sums of sufficient statistics

arguments.name: FCONV=
arguments.description: Specifies the relative function convergence criterion

arguments.name: MAXTIME=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum time allowed in seconds

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies the DIRECT, NETWORK, NETWORKMC, or MCMC algorithm

arguments.name: N=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of Monte Carlo samples

arguments.name: ONDISK
arguments.description: Uses disk space

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: Specifies the initial seed for sampling

arguments.name: STATUSN=
arguments.description: Specifies the sampling interval for printing a status line

arguments.name: STATUSTIME=
arguments.description: Specifies the time interval for printing a status line

arguments.name: XCONV=
arguments.description: Specifies the relative parameter convergence criterion

arguments.name: INEST=
arguments.description: names the SAS data set that contains initial estimates for all the parameters in the model

arguments.name: INMODEL=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the SAS data set that contains the model information needed for scoring new data

arguments.name: MAXRESPONSELEVELS=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of response levels that are allowed in your data set

arguments.name: MULTIPASS
arguments.description: forces the procedure to reread the DATA= data set as needed rather than require its storage in memory or in a temporary file on disk

arguments.name: NAMELEN=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum length of effect names in tables and output data sets to be number characters, where number is a value between 20 and 200

arguments.name: NOCOV
arguments.description: specifies that the covariance matrix not be saved in the OUTMODEL= data set

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: suppresses all displayed output

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the sort order for the levels of the response variable

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: Order of appearance in the input data set

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: External formatted values, except for numeric variables with no explicit format, which are sorted by their unformatted (internal) values

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: Descending frequency count; levels with more observations come earlier in the order

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: Unformatted value

arguments.name: OUTDESIGN=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the data set that contains the design matrix for the model

arguments.name: OUTDESIGNONLY
arguments.description: suppresses the model fitting and creates only the OUTDESIGN= data set

arguments.name: OUTEST=
arguments.description: creates an output SAS data set that contains the final parameter estimates and, optionally, their estimated covariances

arguments.name: OUTMODEL=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the SAS data set that contains the information about the fitted model

arguments.name: PLOTS
arguments.description: controls the plots produced through ODS Graphics

arguments.name: LABEL
arguments.description: displays a label on diagnostic plots to aid in identifying the outlying observations

arguments.name: MAXPOINTS=
arguments.description: suppresses the plots produced by the DFBETAS, DPC, INFLUENCE, LEVERAGE, and PHAT options if there are more than number observations

arguments.name: ONLY
arguments.description: displays only specifically requested plot-requests

arguments.name: UNPACKPANELS
arguments.description: suppresses paneling

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: produces all appropriate plots

arguments.name: CALIBRATION
arguments.description: displays calibration plots for the fitted model

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the significance level for constructing two-sided 100(1--number)% confidence intervals of the mean predicted values

arguments.name: CLM
arguments.description: displays confidence limits of the mean predicted values

arguments.name: RANGE=
arguments.description: specifies the range of the axes

arguments.name: SHOWOBS
arguments.description: displays a bar chart of the predicted probabilities in the upper and lower margins of the plot; the predicted probability axis is divided into 200 bins of equal width

arguments.name: SMOOTH=
arguments.description: specifies the smoothing parameter, which is the fraction of the data in each local neighborhood for the loess fit

arguments.name: UNPACKPANELS
arguments.description: displays the plots separately

arguments.name: DFBETAS
arguments.description: displays plots of DFBETAS versus the case (observation) number

arguments.name: DPC
arguments.description: displays plots of DIFCHISQ and DIFDEV versus the predicted event probability, and displays the markers according to the value of the confidence interval displacement C

arguments.name: MAXSIZE=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum size when TYPE=BUBBLE or TYPE=LABEL

arguments.name: MAXVALUE=
arguments.description: displays all observations for which C ≥ Cmax at the value of the MAXSIZE= option when TYPE=BUBBLE or TYPE=LABEL

arguments.name: MINSIZE=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum size when TYPE=BUBBLE or TYPE=LABEL

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies how the C statistic is displayed

arguments.name: BUBBLE
arguments.description: displays circular markers whose areas are proportional to C and whose colors are determined by their response.

arguments.name: GRADIENT
arguments.description: colors the markers according to the value of C.

arguments.name: LABEL
arguments.description: displays the ID variables (if an ID statement is specified) or the observation number.

arguments.name: UNPACKPANELS
arguments.description: displays the plots separately

arguments.name: EFFECT
arguments.description: displays and enhances the effect plots for the model

arguments.name: AT
arguments.description: specifies fixed values for a covariate

arguments.name: FITOBSONLY
arguments.description: computes the predicted values only at the observed data

arguments.name: INDIVIDUAL
arguments.description: displays the individual probabilities instead of the cumulative probabilities

arguments.name: LINK
arguments.description: displays the linear predictors instead of the probabilities on the Y axis

arguments.name: PLOTBY=
arguments.description: displays an effect plot at each unique level of the PLOTBY= effect

arguments.name: SLICEBY=
arguments.description: displays predicted probabilities at each unique level of the SLICEBY= effect

arguments.name: X=
arguments.description: specifies effects to be used on the X axis of the effect plots

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the size of the confidence limits

arguments.name: CLBAND
arguments.description: displays confidence limits on the plots

arguments.name: CLBAR
arguments.description: displays the error bars on the plots when you have CLASS covariates on the X axis; if the X axis is continuous, then this invokes the CLBAND option

arguments.name: CLUSTER
arguments.description: displays the levels of the SLICEBY= effect in a side-by-side fashion instead of stacking them

arguments.name: CLUSTERGRID
arguments.description: separates the CLASS covariate levels on the X axis with grid lines when the levels of the SLICEBY= effect are clustered

arguments.name: CONNECT
arguments.description: connects the predicted values with a line

arguments.name: EXTEND=
arguments.description: extends continuous X axes by a factor of value/2 in each direction

arguments.name: MAXATLEN=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of characters to use to display the levels of all the fixed variables

arguments.name: NOCLUSTER
arguments.description: prevents clustering of the levels of the SLICEBY= effect

arguments.name: NOCLUSTERGRID
arguments.description: removes the default grid lines that separate the levels of the CLASS covariates on the X axis when the SLICEBY= effect is clustered

arguments.name: NOCONNECT
arguments.description: removes the line that connects the predicted values

arguments.name: POLYBAR
arguments.description: replaces scatter plots of polytomous response models with bar charts

arguments.name: SHOWOBS
arguments.description: displays observations on the plot when the MAXPOINTS= cutoff is not exceeded

arguments.name: YRANGE=
arguments.description: displays the Y axis as [min,max]

arguments.name: INFLUENCE
arguments.description: displays index plots of RESCHI, RESDEV, leverage, confidence interval displacements C and CBar, DIFCHISQ, and DIFDEV

arguments.name: LEVERAGE
arguments.description: displays plots of DIFCHISQ, DIFDEV, confidence interval displacement C, and the predicted probability versus the leverage

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses all plots

arguments.name: ODDSRATIO
arguments.description: displays and enhances the odds ratio plots for the model

arguments.name: CLDISPLAY=
arguments.description: controls the look of the confidence limits
arguments.help: CLDISPLAY=SERIF | SERIFARROW | LINE | LINEARROW | BAR<*width*> | NONE

arguments.name: DOTPLOT
arguments.description: dotted gridlines on the plot

arguments.name: GROUP
arguments.description: the odds ratios in panels that are defined by the ODDSRATIO statements

arguments.name: LOGBASE=
arguments.description: displays the odds ratio axis on the specified log scale

arguments.name: NAT=
arguments.description: specifies the number of starting values at which to compute the special plots of odds ratios of continuous variables

arguments.name: NPANELPOS=
arguments.description: breaks the plot into multiple graphics that have at most |number| odds ratios per graphic

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: displays the odds ratios in sorted order

arguments.name: RANGE=
arguments.description: specifies the range of the displayed odds ratio axis

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: the look of the graphic

arguments.name: UNPACKPANELS
arguments.description: displays plots separately when the default display shows multiple plots together as a panel of plots

arguments.name: PHAT
arguments.description: displays plots of DIFCHISQ, DIFDEV, confidence interval displacement C, and leverage versus the predicted event probability

arguments.name: PR
arguments.description: displays the precision-recall (PR) curve for binary and binomial response models

arguments.name: ROC
arguments.description: displays the ROC curve

arguments.name: ID
arguments.description: labels certain points on the ROC curve

arguments.name: 1MSPEC
arguments.description: displays the false positive fraction (1 -- specificity).

arguments.name: FALPOS
arguments.description: displays the fraction of falsely predicted event responses.

arguments.name: FALNEG
arguments.description: displays the fraction of falsely predicted nonevent responses.

arguments.name: ID
arguments.description: displays the ID variables.

arguments.name: MISCLASS
arguments.description: displays the misclassification rate.

arguments.name: NEGPRED
arguments.description: displays the negative predictive value

arguments.name: OBS
arguments.description: displays the (last) observation number.

arguments.name: OPTSTAT
arguments.description: displays the value of the first statistic specified in the OPTIMAL= option.

arguments.name: POSPRED
arguments.description: displays the positive predictive value

arguments.name: PROB
arguments.description: displays the model predicted probability.

arguments.name: SENSIT
arguments.description: displays the true positive fraction (sensitivity).

arguments.name: ROCOPTIONS
arguments.description: specifies options that apply to every model specified in a ROC statement

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: sets the significance level for creating confidence limits of the areas and the pairwise differences

arguments.name: AREA
arguments.description: displays a table of the area under the empirical ROC curve, the area under the convex hull of the empirical ROC curve when METHOD=CONVEXHULL, the area under the binormal ROC curve when METHOD=BINORMAL, the area under the lower ROC curve when METHOD=LOWER, and the area under the PR curve when PLOTS=PR

arguments.name: CROSSVALIDATE
arguments.description: uses cross validated predicted probabilities instead of the model-predicted probabilities for all ROC and area under the ROC curve (AUC) computations and for all PR curve and area computations

arguments.name: EPS=
arguments.description: is an alias for the ROCEPS= option in the MODEL statement; however, if you also specify that ROCEPS= value, then this option is ignored

arguments.name: ID
arguments.description: displays labels on certain points on the individual ROC and PR curves and also on the SCORE statement's ROC and PR curves

arguments.name: 1MSPEC
arguments.description: displays the false positive fraction (1 -- specificity).

arguments.name: FALPOS
arguments.description: displays the fraction of falsely predicted event responses.

arguments.name: FALNEG
arguments.description: displays the fraction of falsely predicted nonevent responses.

arguments.name: ID
arguments.description: displays the ID variables.

arguments.name: MISCLASS
arguments.description: displays the misclassification rate.

arguments.name: NEGPRED
arguments.description: displays the negative predictive value

arguments.name: OBS
arguments.description: displays the (last) observation number.

arguments.name: OPTSTAT
arguments.description: displays the value of the first statistic specified in the OPTIMAL= option.

arguments.name: POSPRED
arguments.description: displays the positive predictive value

arguments.name: PROB
arguments.description: displays the model predicted probability.

arguments.name: SENSIT
arguments.description: displays the true positive fraction (sensitivity).

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: specifies the method that is used to estimate the ROC and PR curves.

arguments.name: NODETAILS
arguments.description: suppresses the display of the model fitting information for the models specified in the ROC statements

arguments.name: OPTIMAL
arguments.description: marks observed thresholds on the ROC and PR curves that optimize the given statistics, and adds these statistics to the OUTROC= data set

arguments.name: ACCURACY
arguments.description: marks the observed threshold that has the most correct observations.

arguments.name: COST
arguments.description: marks the threshold that has the maximum cost criterion

arguments.name: TP=
arguments.description: is the cost of a true positive

arguments.name: TN=
arguments.description: is the cost of a true negative

arguments.name: FP=
arguments.description: is the cost of a false positive

arguments.name: FN=
arguments.description: is the cost of a false negative

arguments.name: COSTRATIO=
arguments.description: is the cost ratio

arguments.name: DIST01
arguments.description: marks the threshold where the pair (sensitivity,1 -- specificity) is closest to (0,1).

arguments.name: EFFICIENCY
arguments.description: marks the threshold that has the maximum efficiency.

arguments.name: F
arguments.description: marks the threshold that has the maximum F score

arguments.name: GMEAN
arguments.description: marks the threshold that has the largest geometric mean.

arguments.name: MCC
arguments.description: marks the threshold that has the maximum Matthews correlation coefficient (phi coefficient).

arguments.name: MCOST
arguments.description: marks the threshold that has the largest misclassification cost criterion.

arguments.name: FP=
arguments.description: is the cost of a false positive

arguments.name: FN=
arguments.description: is the cost of a false negative

arguments.name: COSTRATIO=
arguments.description: is the cost ratio

arguments.name: SSPDIFF
arguments.description: marks the threshold where sensitivity and sensitivity are most equal.

arguments.name: YOUDEN
arguments.description: marks the threshold that has the maximum Youden index

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: is an alias for the OUTROC= option in the MODEL statement

arguments.name: THINX=
arguments.description: suppresses labels on the ROC curve for any threshold that is too close to the preceding threshold's label

arguments.name: THINY=
arguments.description: suppresses labels on the ROC and PR curves for any threshold that is too close to the preceding threshold's label

arguments.name: WEIGHTED
arguments.description: uses frequency weight in the ROC and PR computations instead of just frequency

arguments.name: SIMPLE
arguments.description: displays simple descriptive statistics (mean, standard deviation, minimum, and maximum) for each continuous explanatory variable

arguments.name: TRUNCATE
arguments.description: determines class levels by using no more than the first 16 characters of the formatted values of CLASS, response, and strata variables

statements.name: BY
statements.description: produces separate analyses of observations in groups that are defined by the BY variables

statements.name: CLASS
statements.description: names the classification variables to be used as explanatory variables in the analysis

arguments.name: CPREFIX=
arguments.description: specifies that, at most, the first n characters of a CLASS variable name be used in creating names for the corresponding design variables

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: reverses the sort order of the classification variable

arguments.name: LPREFIX=
arguments.description: specifies that, at most, the first n characters of a CLASS variable label be used in creating labels for the corresponding design variables

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: treats missing values (., ._, .A,..., .Z for numeric variables and blanks for character variables) as valid values of the CLASS variable

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the sort order for the levels of classification variables

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: Order of appearance in the input data set

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: External formatted values, except for numeric variables with no explicit format, which are sorted by their unformatted (internal) values

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: Descending frequency count; levels with more observations come earlier in the order

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: Unformatted value

arguments.name: PARAM=
arguments.description: specifies the parameterization method for the classification variable or variables

arguments.name: EFFECT
arguments.description: Effect coding

arguments.name: GLM
arguments.description: Less-than-full-rank reference cell coding (this keyword can be used only in a global option)

arguments.name: ORDINAL
arguments.description: Cumulative parameterization for an ordinal CLASS variable

arguments.name: POLYNOMIAL
arguments.description: Polynomial coding

arguments.name: REFERENCE
arguments.description: Reference cell coding

arguments.name: ORTHEFFECT
arguments.description: Orthogonalizes PARAM=EFFECT coding

arguments.name: ORTHORDINAL
arguments.description: Orthogonalizes PARAM=ORDINAL coding

arguments.name: ORTHPOLY
arguments.description: Orthogonalizes PARAM=POLYNOMIAL coding

arguments.name: ORTHREF
arguments.description: Orthogonalizes PARAM=REFERENCE coding

arguments.name: REF=
arguments.description: specifies the reference level for PARAM=EFFECT, PARAM=REFERENCE, and their orthogonalizations

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: designates the first ordered level as reference.

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: designates the last ordered level as reference.

arguments.name: TRUNCATE
arguments.description: specifies the length n of CLASS variable values to use in determining CLASS variable levels

statements.name: CODE
statements.description: writes SAS DATA step code for computing predicted values of the fitted model either to a file or to a catalog entry

arguments.name: CATALOG=
arguments.description: Names the catalog entry where the generated code is saved

arguments.name: DUMMIES
arguments.description: Retains the dummy variables in the data set

arguments.name: ERROR
arguments.description: Computes the error function

arguments.name: FILE=
arguments.description: Names the file where the generated code is saved

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: Specifies the numeric format for the regression coefficients

arguments.name: GROUP=
arguments.description: Specifies the group identifier for array names and statement labels

arguments.name: IMPUTE
arguments.description: Imputes predicted values for observations with missing or invalid covariates

arguments.name: LINESIZE=
arguments.description: Specifies the line size of the generated code

arguments.name: LOOKUP=
arguments.description: Specifies the algorithm for looking up CLASS levels

arguments.name: RESIDUAL
arguments.description: Computes residuals

statements.name: CONTRAST
statements.description: provides a mechanism for obtaining customized hypothesis tests
statements.help: CONTRAST  'label' row-description<,..., row-description></ options>;                                              *row-description* =*effect values*<,..., *effect values*> = a row of L*b = 0                     *label* =identifies the contrast in the displayed output                     *effect* =identifies an effect that appears in the MODEL statement                     *values* =constants that are elements of the L matrix associated with the effect

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the level of significance α for the 100(1-α)% confidence interval for each contrast when the ESTIMATE option is specified

arguments.name: E
arguments.description: displays the L matrix

arguments.name: ESTIMATE=
arguments.description: estimates and tests each individual contrast

arguments.name: PARM
arguments.description: estimates the individual contrast.

arguments.name: EXP
arguments.description: estimates the exponentiated contrast.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: estimates both the individual contrast and the exponentiated contrast.

arguments.name: PROB
arguments.description: estimates the predicted probability of the contrast.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: estimates the individual contrast, the exponentiated contrast, and the predicted probability of the contrast.

arguments.name: SINGULAR=
arguments.description: tunes the estimability check

statements.name: EFFECT
statements.description: enables you to construct special collections of columns for design matrices
statements.help: EFFECT  name=effect-type (variables </ options>);                                                                       effect-type = COLLECTION | LAG | MULTIMEMBER | POLYNOMIAL | SPLINE                                              options = options for that specific type of effect

arguments.name: COLLECTION
arguments.description: specifies a collection effect that defines one or more variables as a single effect with multiple degrees of freedom.

arguments.name: DETAILS
arguments.description: Displays the constituents of the collection effect

arguments.name: LAG
arguments.description: specifies a classification effect in which the level that is used for a particular period corresponds to the level in the preceding period.

arguments.name: DESIGNROLE=
arguments.description: Names a variable that controls to which lag design an observation is assigned

arguments.name: DETAILS
arguments.description: Displays the lag design of the lag effect

arguments.name: NLAG=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of periods in the lag

arguments.name: PERIOD=
arguments.description: Names the variable that defines the period. This option is required

arguments.name: WITHIN=
arguments.description: Names the variable or variables that define the group within which each period is defined. This option is required

arguments.name: MULTIMEMBER
arguments.description: specifies a multimember classification effect whose levels are determined by one or more variables that appear in a CLASS statement.

arguments.name: NOEFFECT
arguments.description: Specifies that observations with all missing levels for the multimember variables should have zero values in the corresponding design matrix columns

arguments.name: WEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the weight variable for the contributions of each of the classification effects

arguments.name: POLYNOMIAL
arguments.description: specifies a multivariate polynomial effect in the specified numeric variables.

arguments.name: DEGREE=
arguments.description: Specifies the degree of the polynomial

arguments.name: MDEGREE=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum degree of any variable in a term of the polynomial

arguments.name: STANDARDIZE=
arguments.description: Specifies centering and scaling suboptions for the variables that define the polynomial

arguments.name: SPLINE
arguments.description: specifies a regression spline effect whose columns are univariate spline expansions of one or more variables.

arguments.name: BASIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the type of basis (B-spline basis or truncated power function basis) for the spline effect

arguments.name: DEGREE=
arguments.description: Specifies the degree of the spline effect

arguments.name: KNOTMETHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies how to construct the knots for the spline effect

statements.name: EFFECTPLOT
statements.description: produces a display of the fitted model and provides options for changing and enhancing the displays
statements.help: EFFECTPLOT <*plot-type*<(plot-definition-options)>></ options>;                                                                       plot-type = BOX | CONTOUR | FIT | INTERACTION | MOSAIC | SLICEFIT

arguments.name: ADDCELL
arguments.description: adds value to every cell in MOSAIC plot-types

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the significance level for FIT, INTERACTION, and SLICEFIT plots

arguments.name: AT
arguments.description: specifies values at which to fix continuous and CLASS variables
arguments.help: AT <MEAN MIN MAX MIDRANGE> <ALL REF BALANCE> <(*class-variable*(*level*)=*value**variable*<(CODED)>=*number-list* | *'class-level'...'class-level'*...)>

arguments.name: ATLEN=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum length of the levels of the AT variables that are displayed in footnotes and headers

arguments.name: ATORDER=
arguments.description: uses the AT values for continuous variables in ascending or descending order

arguments.name: BIN
arguments.description: displays the statistic for the MOSAIC plot with a discrete coloring scheme

arguments.name: BOXWIDTH=
arguments.description: specifies the relative width of the boxes of the BOX plots

arguments.name: CLI
arguments.description: displays prediction limits for normal distributions with identity links for INTERACTION and SLICEFIT plots

arguments.name: CLM
arguments.description: displays confidence limits for INTERACTION and SLICEFIT plots

arguments.name: CLUSTER
arguments.description: modifies BOX and INTERACTION plots by displaying the levels of the SLICEBY= effect side by side

arguments.name: CLUSTERGRID

arguments.name: CONNECT
arguments.description: modifies BOX and INTERACTION plots by connecting the predicted values with a line

arguments.name: EQUAL
arguments.description: causes every cell in MOSAIC plots to have the same dimensions

arguments.name: EXTEND=
arguments.description: extends continuous covariate axes in all directions for CONTOUR, FIT, and SLICEFIT plots

arguments.name: GRIDSIZE=

arguments.name: ILINK
arguments.description: displays the fit on the scale of the inverse link function

arguments.name: INDIVIDUAL
arguments.description: displays individual probabilities for cumulative response models (not BOX)

arguments.name: LIMITS
arguments.description: displays confidence and prediction limits

arguments.name: LINK
arguments.description: displays the fit on the scale of the link function (not MOSAIC)

arguments.name: NCOLS=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of columns in a paneled plot (not BOX nor MOSAIC)

arguments.name: NOBORDER
arguments.description: removes the border from MOSAIC plot cells

arguments.name: NOCLI

arguments.name: NOCLM
arguments.description: suppresses the confidence limits for FIT plots

arguments.name: NOCLUSTER

arguments.name: NOCLUSTERGRID
arguments.description: removes the grid lines from INTERACTION plots

arguments.name: NOCONNECT

arguments.name: NOLABELOUTLIER

arguments.name: NOLIMITS

arguments.name: NOOBS
arguments.description: suppresses the display of observations (not BOX nor MOSAIC)

arguments.name: NOOFFSET
arguments.description: moves the offset for a Poisson regression model to the response side of the equation

arguments.name: MOFF
arguments.description: moves the offset for a Poisson regression model to the response side of the equation

arguments.name: NROWS=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of rows in a paneled plot (not BOX nor MOSAIC)

arguments.name: OBS
arguments.description: displays observations in the effect plots

arguments.name: CGRADIENT=
