arguments.description: displays observations in a fringe (rug) plot at the bottom of the plot

arguments.name: JITTER
arguments.description: shifts (jitters) the observations

arguments.name: FACTOR=
arguments.description: sets the X and Y jitter to factor times the range of the axis

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: an integer to use as the initial seed for the random number generator

arguments.name: X=
arguments.description: sets the X jitter to x-jitter

arguments.name: Y=
arguments.description: sets the Y jitter to y-jitter

arguments.name: LABEL
arguments.description: labels markers with their observation number

arguments.name: LOCATION=
arguments.description: specifies where the observed values for polytomous response models are displayed

arguments.name: BOTTOM
arguments.description: displays the response levels at intervals from the minimum predicted value

arguments.name: CURVE
arguments.description: displays the observations for polytomous response models at their predicted values

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: displays the observations for a response level at the first displayed predicted value for that response level

arguments.name: MAX
arguments.description: displays the observations at the maximum displayed predicted value for that response level

arguments.name: MIDDLE
arguments.description: displays the observations at the middle of the displayed predicted values for that response level

arguments.name: MIN
arguments.description: displays the observations at the minimum displayed predicted value for that response level

arguments.name: SPREAD
arguments.description: displays the observations with the response levels evenly spread across the Y axis

arguments.name: TOP
arguments.description: displays the response levels at intervals from the maximum predicted value

arguments.name: PLOTBYLEN=
arguments.description: the maximum length of the levels of the PLOTBY= variables displayed in footnotes and headers

arguments.name: POLYBAR
arguments.description: displays polytomous response data as a stacked histogram whose bar heights are defined by the individual predicted value in INTERACTION plots

arguments.name: PREDLABEL=
arguments.description: specifies a label to be displayed on the Y axis

arguments.name: SHOWCLEGEND
arguments.description: displays the gradient legend for CONTOUR plots

arguments.name: SMOOTH
arguments.description: overlays a loess smooth on FIT plots with one continuous predictor

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of display for the MOSAIC plots

arguments.name: UNPACK
arguments.description: suppresses paneling

arguments.name: YRANGE=
arguments.description: display range of the predicted values on the Y axis for BOX, FIT, INTERACTION, and SLICEFIT plots

arguments.name: BOX
arguments.description: Displays a box plot of continuous response data at each level of a CLASS effect, with predicted values superimposed and connected by a line.

arguments.name: CONTOUR
arguments.description: Displays a contour plot of predicted values against two continuous covariates.

arguments.name: FIT
arguments.description: Displays a curve of predicted values versus a continuous variable.

arguments.name: INTERACTION
arguments.description: Displays a plot of predicted values (possibly with error bars) versus the levels of a CLASS effect. The predicted values are connected with lines and can be grouped by the levels of another CLASS effect.

arguments.name: MOSAIC
arguments.description: Displays a mosaic plot of predicted values using up to three CLASS effects.

arguments.name: SLICEFIT
arguments.description: Displays a curve of predicted values versus a continuous variable grouped by the levels of a CLASS effect.

arguments.name: PLOTBY=
arguments.description: specifies an effect at whose levels the predicted values are computed and the plots are displayed for all plots

arguments.name: COLUMNS
arguments.description: the columns within each panel correspond to different levels of the PLOTBY= effect

arguments.name: PACK
arguments.description: plots are displayed in the panels as they are produced

arguments.name: PANELS
arguments.description: each level of the PLOTBY= effect begins a new panel of plots

arguments.name: ROWS
arguments.description: the rows within each panel correspond to different levels of the PLOTBY= effect

arguments.name: SLICEBY=
arguments.description: displays the fitted values at the different levels of the specified effect, for INTERACTION and SLICEFIT plots

arguments.name: X=
arguments.description: specifies values to display on the X axis for all plots

arguments.name: Y=
arguments.description: specifies values to display on the Y axis for CONTOUR plots

statements.name: ESTIMATE
statements.description: provides a mechanism for obtaining custom hypothesis tests
statements.help: ESTIMATE <'label'> estimate-specification <(divisor=*n*)><,...<'label'> estimate-specification <(divisor=*n*)>></ options>;                                                                       estimate-specification = effect <values>...

arguments.name: DIVISOR=
arguments.description: Specifies a list of values to divide the coefficients

arguments.name: NOFILL
arguments.description: Suppresses the automatic fill-in of coefficients for higher-order effects

arguments.name: SINGULAR=
arguments.description: Tunes the estimability checking difference

arguments.name: ADJUST=
arguments.description: Determines the method of multiple comparison adjustment of estimates

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Determines the confidence level

arguments.name: LOWER
arguments.description: Performs one-sided, lower-tailed inference

arguments.name: STEPDOWN
arguments.description: Adjusts multiplicity-corrected p-values further in a step-down fashion

arguments.name: TESTVALUE=
arguments.description: Specifies values under the null hypothesis for tests

arguments.name: UPPER
arguments.description: Performs one-sided, upper-tailed inference

arguments.name: CL
arguments.description: Constructs confidence limits

arguments.name: CORR
arguments.description: Displays the correlation matrix of estimates

arguments.name: COV
arguments.description: Displays the covariance matrix of estimates

arguments.name: E
arguments.description: Prints the L matrix

arguments.name: JOINT
arguments.description: Produces a joint F or chi-square test for the estimable functions

arguments.name: PLOTS=
arguments.description: Produces ODS statistical graphics if the analysis is sampling-based

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: Specifies the seed for computations that depend on random numbers

arguments.name: CATEGORY=
arguments.description: Specifies how to construct estimable functions for multinomial data

arguments.name: EXP
arguments.description: Exponentiates and displays estimates

arguments.name: ILINK
arguments.description: Computes and displays estimates and standard errors on the inverse linked scale

statements.name: EXACT
statements.description: performs exact tests of the parameters for the specified effects and optionally estimates the parameters and outputs the exact conditional distributions

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the level of significance α for 100(1-α)% confidence limits for the parameters or odds ratios

arguments.name: CLTYPE=
arguments.description: requests either the exact or mid-p confidence intervals for the parameter estimates

arguments.name: ESTIMATE
arguments.description: estimates the individual parameters (conditioned on all other parameters) for the effects specified in the EXACT statement

arguments.name: PARM
arguments.description: specifies that the parameters be estimated. This is the default.

arguments.name: ODDS
arguments.description: specifies that the odds ratios be estimated. If you have classification variables, then you must also specify the PARAM=REF option in the CLASS statement.

arguments.name: BOTH
arguments.description: specifies that both the parameters and odds ratios be estimated.

arguments.name: JOINT
arguments.description: performs the joint test that all of the parameters are simultaneously equal to zero, performs individual hypothesis tests for the parameter of each continuous variable, and performs joint tests for the parameters of each classification variable

arguments.name: JOINTONLY
arguments.description: performs only the joint test of the parameters

arguments.name: MIDPFACTOR=
arguments.description: sets the tie factors used to produce the mid-p hypothesis statistics and the mid-p confidence intervals

arguments.name: ONESIDED
arguments.description: requests one-sided confidence intervals and p-values for the individual parameter estimates and odds ratios

arguments.name: OUTDIST=
arguments.description: names the SAS data set that contains the exact conditional distributions

statements.name: EXACTOPTIONS
statements.description: specifies options that apply to every EXACT statement in the program

arguments.name: ABSFCONV=
arguments.description: specifies the absolute function convergence criterion

arguments.name: ADDTOBS
arguments.description: the observed sufficient statistic to the sampled exact distribution if the statistic was not sampled

arguments.name: BUILDSUBSETS
arguments.description: every distribution for sampling

arguments.name: EPSILON=
arguments.description: how the partial sums are compared

arguments.name: FCONV=
arguments.description: specifies the relative function convergence criterion

arguments.name: MAXSWAP=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of swaps for each sample that PROC LOGISTIC makes when you specify the METHOD=MCMC option

arguments.name: MAXTIME=
arguments.description: the maximum clock time (in seconds) that PROC LOGISTIC can use to calculate the exact distributions

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: which exact conditional algorithm to use for every EXACT statement specified

arguments.name: DIRECT
arguments.description: invokes the multivariate shift algorithm

arguments.name: NETWORK
arguments.description: invokes a network algorithm

arguments.name: NETWORKMC
arguments.description: invokes the hybrid network and Monte Carlo algorithm

arguments.name: MCMC
arguments.description: invokes the Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) algorithm

arguments.name: N=
arguments.description: the number of Monte Carlo samples to take when you specify the METHOD=NETWORKMC or METHOD=MCMC option

arguments.name: NBI=
arguments.description: specifies the number of burn-in samples that are discarded when you specify the METHOD=MCMC option

arguments.name: NOLOGSCALE
arguments.description: specifies that computations for the exact conditional models be computed by using normal scaling

arguments.name: NTHIN=
arguments.description: the thinning rate of the sampling when you specify the METHOD=MCMC option

arguments.name: ONDISK
arguments.description: disk space instead of random access memory to build the exact conditional distribution

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: the initial seed for the random number generator used to take the Monte Carlo samples when you specify the METHOD=NETWORKMC or METHOD=MCMC option

arguments.name: STATUSN=
arguments.description: a status line in the SAS log after every number of Monte Carlo samples when you specify the METHOD=NETWORKMC or METHOD=MCMC option

arguments.name: STATUSTIME=
arguments.description: the time interval (in seconds) for printing a status line in the SAS log

arguments.name: XCONV=
arguments.description: specifies the relative parameter convergence criterion

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: identifies a variable that contains the frequency of occurrence of each observation

statements.name: ID
statements.description: specifies variables in the DATA= data set that are used for labeling ROC and PR curves and influence diagnostic plots

statements.name: LSMEANS
statements.description: computes and compares least squares means (LS-means) of fixed effects

arguments.name: AT
arguments.description: Modifies the covariate value in computing LS-means

arguments.name: MEANS
arguments.description: sets covariates equal to their mean values

arguments.name: variable=
arguments.description: sets the covariate variable equal to value.

arguments.name: (variable-list)=(value-list)
arguments.description: sets covariates in the variable-list equal to values in the value-list.

arguments.name: BYLEVEL
arguments.description: Computes separate margins

arguments.name: DIFF
arguments.description: Computes differences of LS-means

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: displays all pairwise differences.

arguments.name: ANOM
arguments.description: displays differences between each LS-mean and the average LS-mean

arguments.name: CONTROL
arguments.description: produces two-tailed tests and confidence limits for differences with a control

arguments.name: CONTROLL
arguments.description: produces one-tailed results and tests whether the noncontrol levels are significantly smaller than the control.

arguments.name: CONTROLU
arguments.description: produces one-tailed results and tests whether the noncontrol levels are significantly larger than the control.

arguments.name: OM=
arguments.description: Specifies the weighting scheme for LS-means computation as determined by the input data set

arguments.name: SINGULAR=
arguments.description: Tunes estimability checking

arguments.name: ADJUST=
arguments.description: Determines the method of multiple-comparison adjustment of LS-means differences

arguments.name: BON
arguments.description: performs Bonferroni t tests of differences between LS-means.

arguments.name: DUNNETT
arguments.description: performs Dunnett's t test, which tests whether any treatments are significantly different from a single control

arguments.name: NELSON
arguments.description: performs Nelson's t test of each LS-mean against an average of the LS-means

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: performs no adjustment for multiple comparisons.

arguments.name: T
arguments.description: performs no adjustment for multiple comparisons.

arguments.name: SCHEFFE
arguments.description: performs Scheffe's multiple comparison procedure.

arguments.name: SIDAK
arguments.description: performs pairwise t tests on differences between LS-means with levels adjusted according to Sidak's inequality.

arguments.name: SIMULATE
arguments.description: performs the simulation-based multiple comparison procedure.

arguments.name: CVADJUST
arguments.description: estimates the quantile by the control variate adjustment method

arguments.name: EPS=
arguments.description: specifies a 100 (1-ε) confidence interval for the true probability content of the estimated (1-α) quantile.

arguments.name: NSAMP=
arguments.description: specifies the sample size for the simulation.

arguments.name: REPORT
arguments.description: displays a report on the simulation

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: specifies an integer to be used to start the pseudorandom number generator for the simulation.

arguments.name: SMM
arguments.description: performs pairwise comparisons based on the studentized maximum modulus and Sidak's uncorrelated-t inequality

arguments.name: GT2
arguments.description: performs pairwise comparisons based on the studentized maximum modulus and Sidak's uncorrelated-t inequality

arguments.name: TUKEY
arguments.description: performs Tukey's studentized range test on LS-means.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Determines the confidence level

arguments.name: STEPDOWN
arguments.description: Adjusts multiple-comparison p-values further in a step-down fashion

arguments.name: MAXTIME=
arguments.description: specifies the time (in seconds) for TYPE=LOGICAL.

arguments.name: REPORT
arguments.description: specifies that a report on the step-down adjustment be displayed

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: use maximal logically consistent sequential subsets of equality hypotheses

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: sequential subsets are computed ignoring logical constraints.

arguments.name: ASC
arguments.description: Sorts LS-means in ascending order in results that you display by specifying the LINES option

arguments.name: CL
arguments.description: Constructs confidence limits for means and mean differences

arguments.name: CORR
arguments.description: Displays the correlation matrix of LS-means

arguments.name: COV
arguments.description: Displays the covariance matrix of LS-means

arguments.name: E
arguments.description: Prints the L matrix

arguments.name: LINES
arguments.description: Uses connecting lines to indicate nonsignificantly different subsets of LS-means

arguments.name: LINESTABLE
arguments.description: Displays the results of the LINES option as a table

arguments.name: MEANS
arguments.description: Prints the LS-means

arguments.name: PLOTS
arguments.description: Produces graphs of means and mean comparisons

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: requests the default plots

arguments.name: ANOMPLOT
arguments.description: requests an analysis-of-means display

arguments.name: BOXPLOT
arguments.description: produces box plots of the distribution of the least squares mean or least squares mean differences

arguments.name: ORIENTATION=
arguments.description: specifies the orientation of the boxes

arguments.name: NPANELPOS=
arguments.description: specifies how to break the series of box plots across multiple panels.

arguments.name: CONTROLPLOT
arguments.description: requests a display in which least squares means are visually compared against a reference level.

arguments.name: DIFFOGRAM
arguments.description: requests a display of all pairwise least squares mean differences and their significance.

arguments.name: ABS
arguments.description: all line segments are shown on the same side of the reference line.

arguments.name: NOABS
arguments.description: separates comparisons according to the sign of the difference.

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: marks the center point for each comparison

arguments.name: NOLINES
arguments.description: suppresses the display of the line segments that represent the confidence bounds for the differences of the least squares means

arguments.name: DISTPLOT
arguments.description: generates panels of histograms with a kernel density overlaid if the analysis has access to a set of posterior parameter estimates.

arguments.name: BOX
arguments.description: controls the display of a horizontal box plot

arguments.name: NOBOX
arguments.description: controls the display of a horizontal box plot

arguments.name: HIST
arguments.description: controls the display of the histogram

arguments.name: NOHIST
arguments.description: controls the display of the histogram

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: controls the display of a normal density estimate

arguments.name: NONORMAL
arguments.description: controls the display of a normal density estimate

arguments.name: KERNEL
arguments.description: controls the display of a kernel density estimate

arguments.name: NOKERNEL
arguments.description: controls the display of a kernel density estimate

arguments.name: NROWS=
arguments.description: specifies the highest number of rows in a panel.

arguments.name: NCOLS=
arguments.description: specifies the highest number of columns in a panel

arguments.name: UNPACK
arguments.description: unpacks the panel into separate graphics.

arguments.name: LINESPLOT
arguments.description: modifies the dimensions of the LS-means comparison plot that is produced by the LINES option.

arguments.name: HSCALE=
arguments.description: scales the default height of the plot

arguments.name: WSCALE=
arguments.description: scales the default width of the plot

arguments.name: MEANPLOT
arguments.description: requests displays of the least squares means.

arguments.name: ASCENDING
arguments.description: displays the least squares means in ascending order.

arguments.name: CL
arguments.description: displays upper and lower confidence limits

arguments.name: CLBAND
arguments.description: displays confidence limits as bands.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: displays the least squares means in descending order.

arguments.name: ILINK
arguments.description: requests that means be displayed on the inverse linked scale.

arguments.name: JOIN
arguments.description: connects the least squares means with lines.

arguments.name: CONNECT
arguments.description: connects the least squares means with lines.

arguments.name: SLICEBY=
arguments.description: specifies an effect by which to group the means in a single plot.

arguments.name: PLOTBY=
arguments.description: specifies an effect by which to break interaction plots into separate displays.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: requests that no plots be produced.

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: Specifies the seed for computations that depend on random numbers

arguments.name: EXP
arguments.description: Exponentiates and displays estimates of LS-means or LS-means differences

arguments.name: ILINK
arguments.description: Computes and displays estimates and standard errors of LS-means (but not differences) on the inverse linked scale

arguments.name: ODDSRATIO
arguments.description: Reports (simple) differences of least squares means in terms of odds ratios if permitted by the link function

statements.name: LSMESTIMATE
statements.description: provides a mechanism for obtaining custom hypothesis tests among least squares means

arguments.name: AT
arguments.description: Modifies covariate values in computing LS-means

arguments.name: BYLEVEL
arguments.description: Computes separate margins

arguments.name: DIVISOR=
arguments.description: Specifies a list of values to divide the coefficients

arguments.name: OM=
arguments.description: Specifies the weighting scheme for LS-means computation as determined by a data set

arguments.name: SINGULAR=
arguments.description: Tunes estimability checking

arguments.name: ADJUST=
arguments.description: Determines the method of multiple-comparison adjustment of LS-means differences

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Determines the confidence level

arguments.name: LOWER
arguments.description: Performs one-sided, lower-tailed inference

arguments.name: STEPDOWN
arguments.description: Adjusts multiple-comparison p-values further in a step-down fashion

arguments.name: TESTVALUE=
arguments.description: Specifies values under the null hypothesis for tests

arguments.name: UPPER
arguments.description: Performs one-sided, upper-tailed inference

arguments.name: CL
arguments.description: Constructs confidence limits for means and mean differences

arguments.name: CORR
arguments.description: Displays the correlation matrix of LS-means

arguments.name: COV
arguments.description: Displays the covariance matrix of LS-means

arguments.name: E
arguments.description: Prints the L matrix

arguments.name: ELSM
arguments.description: Prints the K matrix

arguments.name: JOINT
arguments.description: Produces a joint F or chi-square test for the LS-means and LS-means differences

arguments.name: PLOTS=
arguments.description: Produces graphs of means and mean comparisons

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: Specifies the seed for computations that depend on random numbers

arguments.name: CATEGORY=
arguments.description: Specifies how to construct estimable functions for multinomial data

arguments.name: EXP
arguments.description: Exponentiates and displays LS-means estimates

arguments.name: ILINK
arguments.description: Computes and displays estimates and standard errors of LS-means (but not differences) on the inverse linked scale

statements.name: MARGINS
statements.description: computes and compares predictive margins of fixed effects

arguments.name: AT
arguments.description: Modifies the covariate value in computing predictive margins

arguments.name: DIFF
arguments.description: Computes differences of predictive margins

arguments.name: SLICEBY=
arguments.description: Partitions tests of interaction effects

arguments.name: SLICEDIFF
arguments.description: Computes differences of sliced predictive margins and determines the types of differences

arguments.name: USEWEIGHT
arguments.description: Specifies whether to use WEIGHT variables to compute predictive margins

arguments.name: ADJUST=
arguments.description: Specifies the method of multiple comparison adjustment of predictive margin differences

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Specifies the confidence level

arguments.name: STEPDOWN
arguments.description: Adjusts multiple comparison p-values further in a step-down fashion

arguments.name: CL
arguments.description: Constructs confidence limits for predictive margins and/or predictive margin differences

statements.name: MODEL
statements.description: names the response variable and the explanatory effects, including covariates, main effects, interactions, and nested effects

arguments.name: ABSFCONV=
arguments.description: specifies the absolute function convergence criterion

arguments.name: AGGREGATE
arguments.description: specifies the subpopulations on which the Pearson chi-square test statistic and the likelihood ratio chi-square test statistic (deviance) are calculated

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: sets the level of significance α for 100(1-α)% confidence intervals for regression parameters or odds ratios

arguments.name: BEST=
arguments.description: specifies that number models with the highest score chi-square statistics are to be displayed for each model size

arguments.name: BINWIDTH=
arguments.description: specifies the size of the bins used for estimating the association statistics

arguments.name: CLODDS=
arguments.description: produces confidence intervals for odds ratios of main effects not involved in interactions or nestings

arguments.name: CLPARM=
arguments.description: requests confidence intervals for the parameters

arguments.name: CORRB
arguments.description: displays the correlation matrix of the parameter estimates

arguments.name: COVB
arguments.description: displays the covariance matrix of the parameter estimates

arguments.name: CTABLE
arguments.description: classifies the input binary response observations according to whether the predicted event probabilities are above or below some cutpoint value z in the range (0,1)

arguments.name: DETAILS
arguments.description: produces a summary of computational details for each step of the effect selection process

arguments.name: EQUALSLOPES
arguments.description: specifies one or more effects that have the same parameters for each response function in a polytomous response model

arguments.name: EXPB
arguments.description: displays the exponentiated values of the parameter estimates in the "Analysis of Maximum Likelihood Estimates" table for the logit model

arguments.name: FAST
arguments.description: uses a computational algorithm of to compute a first-order approximation to the remaining slope estimates for each subsequent elimination of a variable from the model

arguments.name: FCONV=
arguments.description: specifies the relative function convergence criterion

arguments.name: FIRTH
arguments.description: performs Firth's penalized maximum likelihood estimation to reduce bias in the parameter estimates

arguments.name: GCONV=
arguments.description: specifies the relative gradient convergence criterion

arguments.name: GOF
arguments.description: performs goodness-of-fit tests for specified or selected binary response models and displays more fit statistics

arguments.name: CUTPOINT=
arguments.description: specifies a value between 0 and 1 for which observations that have a larger predicted probability are classified as events and observations that have a smaller predicted probability are classified as nonevents

arguments.name: NOLACKFIT
arguments.description: suppresses the LACKFIT computations

arguments.name: NOPLOT
arguments.description: suppresses the calibration plots

arguments.name: NOSTAT
arguments.description: displays the standard "Model Fit Statistics" table

arguments.name: HALFMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of step halvings to use when you also specify the RIDGING=NONE option

arguments.name: HIERARCHY=
arguments.description: specifies whether and how the model hierarchy requirement is applied and whether a single effect or multiple effects are allowed to enter or leave the model in one step

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: indicates that the model hierarchy is not maintained. Any single effect can enter or leave the model at any given step of the selection process.

arguments.name: SINGLE
arguments.description: indicates that only one effect can enter or leave the model at one time, subject to the model hierarchy requirement.

arguments.name: SINGLECLASS
arguments.description: is the same as HIERARCHY=SINGLE except that only CLASS effects are subject to the hierarchy requirement.

arguments.name: MULTIPLE
arguments.description: indicates that more than one effect can enter or leave the model at one time, subject to the model hierarchy requirement.

arguments.name: MULTIPLECLASS
arguments.description: is the same as HIERARCHY=MULTIPLE except that only CLASS effects are subject to the hierarchy requirement.

arguments.name: INCLUDE=
arguments.description: specifies effects in the MODEL statement to include in every model during model selection

arguments.name: INFLUENCE
arguments.description: displays diagnostic measures for identifying influential observations in the case of a binary or binomial response model

arguments.name: IPLOTS
arguments.description: produces an index plot for the regression diagnostic statistics developed by for binary or binomial response models

arguments.name: ITPRINT
arguments.description: displays the iteration history of the maximum-likelihood model fitting

arguments.name: LACKFIT
arguments.description: performs the Hosmer and Lemeshow goodness-of-fit test for binary and polytomous response models

arguments.name: LINK=
arguments.description: specifies the link function linking the response probabilities to the linear predictors

arguments.name: ALOGIT
arguments.description: is the adjacent-category logit function for polytomous response models.

arguments.name: CLOGLOG
arguments.description: is the complementary log-log function.

arguments.name: GLOGIT
arguments.description: is the generalized logit function for polytomous response models.

arguments.name: LOGIT
arguments.description: is the log odds function.

arguments.name: PROBIT
arguments.description: is the inverse standard normal distribution function.

arguments.name: MAXFUNCTION=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of function calls to perform when you are maximizing the likelihood

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of iterations to perform

arguments.name: MAXSTEP=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of times any explanatory variable is added to or removed from the model when SELECTION=STEPWISE

arguments.name: NOCHECK
arguments.description: disables the checking process to determine whether maximum likelihood estimates of the regression parameters exist

arguments.name: NODUMMYPRINT
arguments.description: suppresses the "Class Level Information" table, which shows how the design matrix columns for the CLASS variables are coded

arguments.name: NOINT
arguments.description: suppresses the intercept for the binary response model, the first intercept for the ordinal response model (which forces all intercepts to be nonnegative), or all intercepts for the generalized logit model

arguments.name: NOFIT
arguments.description: performs the global score test without fitting the model

arguments.name: NOLOGSCALE
arguments.description: specifies that computations for the conditional and exact logistic regression models should be computed by using normal scaling

arguments.name: NOODDSRATIO
arguments.description: suppresses the default "Odds Ratio" table

arguments.name: OFFSET=
arguments.description: names the offset variable

arguments.name: ORPVALUE
arguments.description: displays p-values in tables produced by the CLODDS= option and the ODDSRATIO statement

arguments.name: OUTROC=
arguments.description: creates, for binary response models, an output SAS data set that contains the data necessary to produce the receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve

arguments.name: PARMLABEL
arguments.description: displays the labels of the parameters in the "Analysis of Maximum Likelihood Estimates" table

arguments.name: PCORR
arguments.description: computes the partial correlation statistic for each parameter

arguments.name: PEVENT=
arguments.description: specifies one prior probability or a list of prior probabilities for the event of interest

arguments.name: PLCL
arguments.description: is the same as specifying CLPARM=PL

arguments.name: PLCONV=
arguments.description: controls the convergence criterion for confidence intervals based on the profile-likelihood function

arguments.name: PLRL
arguments.description: is the same as specifying CLODDS=PL

arguments.name: PPROB=
arguments.description: specifies one critical probability value (or cutpoint) or a list of critical probability values for classifying observations with the CTABLE option

arguments.name: RIDGEINIT=
arguments.description: specifies the initial ridge value

arguments.name: RIDGING=
arguments.description: specifies the technique used to improve the log-likelihood function when its value in the current iteration is less than that in the previous iteration

arguments.name: RISKLIMITS
arguments.description: is the same as specifying CLODDS=WALD

arguments.name: ROCCI
arguments.description: displays standard errors and confidence limits for the area under the ROC curve (AUC) statistic when you have a binary response variable

arguments.name: ROCEPS=
arguments.description: specifies a criterion for the ROC and PR curves that is used for grouping estimated event probabilities that are close to each other

arguments.name: RSQUARE
arguments.description: requests a generalized R-square measure for binary and polytomous response models

arguments.name: SCALE=
arguments.description: enables you to supply the value of the dispersion parameter or to specify the method for estimating the dispersion parameter

arguments.name: SELECTION=
arguments.description: specifies the method used to select the variables in the model

arguments.name: SEQUENTIAL
arguments.description: forces effects to be added to the model in the order specified in the MODEL statement or eliminated from the model in the reverse order of that specified in the MODEL statement

arguments.name: SINGULAR=
arguments.description: specifies the tolerance for testing the singularity of the Hessian matrix (Newton-Raphson algorithm) or the expected value of the Hessian matrix (Fisher scoring algorithm)

arguments.name: SLENTRY=
arguments.description: specifies the significance level of the score chi-square for entering an effect into the model in the FORWARD or STEPWISE method

arguments.name: SLSTAY=
arguments.description: specifies the significance level of the Wald chi-square for an effect to stay in the model in a backward elimination step

arguments.name: START=
arguments.description: specifies which effects in the MODEL statement are included in the initial model

arguments.name: STB
arguments.description: displays the standardized estimates for the parameters in the "Analysis of Maximum Likelihood Estimates" table

arguments.name: STOP=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum (SELECTION=FORWARD) or minimum (SELECTION=BACKWARD) number of effects to be included in the final model

arguments.name: STOPRES
arguments.description: specifies that the removal or entry of effects be based on the value of the residual chi-square

arguments.name: TECHNIQUE=
arguments.description: specifies the optimization technique for estimating the regression parameters

arguments.name: UNEQUALSLOPES
arguments.description: specifies one or more effects in a model for which you want a different set of parameters for each response function in a polytomous response model

arguments.name: WALDCL
arguments.description: is the same as specifying CLPARM=WALD

arguments.name: XCONV=
arguments.description: specifies the relative parameter convergence criterion

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: reverses the order of the response categories

arguments.name: EVENT=
arguments.description: specifies the event category for the binary response model

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the sort order for the levels of the response variable

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: Order of appearance in the input data set

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: External formatted value, except for numeric variables with no explicit format, which are sorted by their unformatted (internal) value

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: Descending frequency count; levels with the most observations come first in the order

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: Unformatted value

arguments.name: REFERENCE=
arguments.description: specifies the reference category for the generalized logit model and the binary response model

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: designates the first ordered category as the reference.

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: designates the last ordered category as the reference. This is the default.

statements.name: NLOPTIONS
statements.description: controls the optimization process for conditional analyses (which result from specifying a STRATA statement) and for partial parallel slope models (which result from specifying the EQUALSLOPES or UNEQUALSLOPES option in the MODEL statement)

arguments.name: HESCAL=
arguments.description: Determines the type of Hessian scaling

arguments.name: INHESSIAN=
arguments.description: Specifies the start for approximated Hessian

arguments.name: LINESEARCH=
arguments.description: Specifies the line-search method

arguments.name: LSPRECISION=
arguments.description: Specifies the line-search precision

arguments.name: RESTART=
arguments.description: Specifies the iteration number for update restart

arguments.name: TECHNIQUE=
arguments.description: Determines the minimization technique

arguments.name: UPDATE=
arguments.description: Determines the update technique

arguments.name: ABSCONV=
arguments.description: Tunes an absolute function convergence criterion

arguments.name: ABSFCONV=
arguments.description: Tunes an absolute function difference convergence criterion

arguments.name: ABSGCONV=
arguments.description: Tunes the absolute gradient convergence criterion

arguments.name: ABSXCONV=
arguments.description: Tunes the absolute parameter convergence criterion

arguments.name: FCONV=
arguments.description: Tunes the relative function convergence criterion

arguments.name: FCONV2=
arguments.description: Tunes another relative function convergence criterion

arguments.name: FSIZE=
arguments.description: Specifies the value used in the FCONV and GCONV criteria

arguments.name: GCONV=
arguments.description: Tunes the relative gradient convergence criterion

arguments.name: GCONV2=
arguments.description: Tunes another relative gradient convergence criterion

arguments.name: MAXFUNC=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of function calls

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations

arguments.name: MAXTIME=
arguments.description: Specifies the upper limit for seconds of CPU time

arguments.name: MINITER=
arguments.description: Specifies the minimum number of iterations

arguments.name: XCONV=
arguments.description: Specifies the relative parameter convergence criterion

arguments.name: XSIZE=
arguments.description: Specifies the value used in the XCONV criterion

arguments.name: DAMPSTEP=
arguments.description: Dampens steps in a line search

arguments.name: INSTEP=
arguments.description: Specifies the initial trust region radius

arguments.name: MAXSTEP=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum trust region radius

arguments.name: PALL
arguments.description: Displays (almost) all printed output

arguments.name: PHISTORY
arguments.description: Displays optimization history

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: Suppresses all printed output

arguments.name: ASINGULAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the absolute singularity for inertia

arguments.name: MSINGULAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the relative M singularity for inertia

arguments.name: VSINGULAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the relative V singularity for inertia

arguments.name: LCEPSILON=
arguments.description: Specifies the range for active constraints

arguments.name: LCDEACT=
arguments.description: Specifies the LM tolerance for deactivating

arguments.name: LCSINGULAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the tolerance for dependent constraints

arguments.name: SOCKET=
arguments.description: Specifies the fileref for remote monitoring

statements.name: ODDSRATIO
statements.description: produces odds ratios for variable even when the variable is involved in interactions with other covariates, and for classification variables that use any parameterization

arguments.name: AT
arguments.description: specifies fixed levels for covariates

arguments.name: CL=
arguments.description: specifies whether to create Wald or profile-likelihood confidence limits, or both

arguments.name: DIFF=
arguments.description: specifies whether the odds ratios for a classification variable are computed against the reference level, or all pairs of variable are compared

arguments.name: PLCONV=
arguments.description: controls the convergence criterion for confidence intervals based on the profile-likelihood function

arguments.name: PLMAXITER=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of iterations to perform

arguments.name: PLSINGULAR=
arguments.description: specifies the tolerance for testing the singularity of the Hessian matrix (Newton-Raphson algorithm) or the expected value of the Hessian matrix (Fisher scoring algorithm)

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: creates a new SAS data set that contains all the variables in the input data set and, optionally, the estimated linear predictors and their standard error estimates, the estimates of the cumulative or individual response probabilities, and the confidence limits for the cumulative probabilities

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: sets the level of significance α for 100(1-α)% confidence limits for the appropriate response probabilities

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: names the output data set

arguments.name: C=
arguments.description: specifies the confidence interval displacement diagnostic that measures the influence of individual observations on the regression estimates

arguments.name: CBAR=
arguments.description: specifies the confidence interval displacement diagnostic that measures the overall change in the global regression estimates due to deleting an individual observation

arguments.name: DFBETAS=
arguments.description: specifies the standardized differences in the regression estimates for assessing the effects of individual observations on the estimated regression parameters in the fitted model

arguments.name: DIFCHISQ=
arguments.description: specifies the change in the chi-square goodness-of-fit statistic attributable to deleting the individual observation

arguments.name: DIFDEV=
arguments.description: specifies the change in the deviance attributable to deleting the individual observation

arguments.name: H=
arguments.description: specifies the diagonal element of the hat matrix for detecting extreme points in the design space

arguments.name: LOWER=
arguments.description: names the variable containing the lower confidence limits

arguments.name: PREDICTED=
arguments.description: names the variable containing the predicted probabilities

arguments.name: PREDPROBS=
arguments.description: requests individual, cumulative, or cross validated predicted probabilities

arguments.name: INDIVIDUAL
arguments.description: requests the predicted probability of each response level

arguments.name: CUMULATIVE
arguments.description: requests the cumulative predicted probability of each response level

arguments.name: CROSSVALIDATE
arguments.description: requests the cross validated individual predicted probability of each response level

arguments.name: RESCHI=
arguments.description: specifies the Pearson (chi-square) residual for identifying observations that are poorly accounted for by the model

arguments.name: RESDEV=
arguments.description: specifies the deviance residual for identifying poorly fitted observations

arguments.name: RESLIK=
arguments.description: specifies the likelihood residual for identifying poorly fitted observations

arguments.name: STDRESCHI=
arguments.description: specifies the standardized Pearson (chi-square) residual for identifying observations that are poorly accounted for by the model

arguments.name: STDRESDEV=
arguments.description: specifies the standardized deviance residual for identifying poorly fitted observations

arguments.name: STDXBETA=
arguments.description: names the variable containing the standard error estimates of XBETA

arguments.name: UPPER=
arguments.description: names the variable containing the upper confidence limits

arguments.name: XBETA=
arguments.description: names the variable containing the estimates of the linear predictor

statements.name: ROC
statements.description: specify models to be used in the ROC comparisons
statements.help: ROC <'label'><specification></ options>;                                              *specification* = a list of model effects or PRED=variable

arguments.name: NOINT
arguments.description: suppresses the intercept for the model

arguments.name: NOOFFSET
arguments.description: does not include an offset variable if the OFFSET= option is specified in the MODEL statement

arguments.name: LINK=
arguments.description: specifies the link function to be used in the model

statements.name: ROCCONTRAST
statements.description: compares the different ROC models

arguments.name: E
arguments.description: displays the contrast

arguments.name: ESTIMATE
arguments.description: produces estimates of each row of the contrast when ESTIMATE or ESTIMATE=ROWS is specified

arguments.name: ROWS
arguments.description: produces estimates of each row of the contrast

arguments.name: ALLPAIRS
arguments.description: produces estimates of every pairwise difference of ROC curves

arguments.name: COV
arguments.description: displays covariance matrices used in the computations

arguments.name: REFERENCE
arguments.description: produces a contrast matrix of differences between each ROC curve and a reference curve

arguments.name: ADJACENTPAIRS
arguments.description: produces a contrast matrix of each ROC curve minus the succeeding curve

arguments.name: matrix
arguments.description: specifies the contrast in the form row1,row2,..., where each row contains the coefficients used to compare the ROC curves

statements.name: SCORE
statements.description: creates a data set that contains all the data in the DATA= data set together with posterior probabilities and, optionally, prediction confidence intervals

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the significance level α for 100(1-α)% confidence intervals

arguments.name: CLM
arguments.description: outputs the Wald-test-based confidence limits for the predicted probabilities

arguments.name: CUMULATIVE
arguments.description: outputs the cumulative predicted probabilities to the OUT= data set

arguments.name: CUTPOINT=
arguments.description: specifies a value between 0 and 1 for which observations that have a larger predicted probability are classified as events and observations that have a smaller predicted probability are classified as nonevents

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the SAS data set that you want to score

arguments.name: FITSTAT
arguments.description: displays fit statistics for the data set you are scoring

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: names the SAS data set that contains the predicted information

arguments.name: OUTROC=
arguments.description: names the SAS data set that contains the ROC curve for the DATA= data set

arguments.name: PRIOR=
arguments.description: names the SAS data set that contains the priors of the response categories

arguments.name: PRIOREVENT=
arguments.description: specifies the prior event probability for a binary response model

arguments.name: ROCEPS=
arguments.description: specifies the criterion for grouping estimated event probabilities that are close to each other for the ROC curve

statements.name: SLICE
statements.description: provides a general mechanism for performing a partitioned analysis of the LS-means for an interaction

arguments.name: AT
arguments.description: Modifies the covariate value in computing LS-means

arguments.name: MEANS
arguments.description: sets covariates equal to their mean values

arguments.name: variable=
arguments.description: sets the covariate variable equal to value.

arguments.name: (variable-list)=(value-list)
arguments.description: sets covariates in the variable-list equal to values in the value-list.

arguments.name: BYLEVEL
arguments.description: Computes separate margins

arguments.name: DIFF
arguments.description: Computes differences of LS-means

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: displays all pairwise differences.

arguments.name: ANOM
arguments.description: displays differences between each LS-mean and the average LS-mean

arguments.name: CONTROL
arguments.description: produces two-tailed tests and confidence limits for differences with a control

arguments.name: CONTROLL
arguments.description: produces one-tailed results and tests whether the noncontrol levels are significantly smaller than the control.

arguments.name: CONTROLU
arguments.description: produces one-tailed results and tests whether the noncontrol levels are significantly larger than the control.

arguments.name: OM=
arguments.description: Specifies the weighting scheme for LS-means computation as determined by the input data set

arguments.name: SINGULAR=
arguments.description: Tunes estimability checking

arguments.name: ADJUST=
arguments.description: Determines the method of multiple-comparison adjustment of LS-means differences

arguments.name: BON
arguments.description: performs Bonferroni t tests of differences between LS-means.

arguments.name: DUNNETT
arguments.description: performs Dunnett's t test, which tests whether any treatments are significantly different from a single control

arguments.name: NELSON
arguments.description: performs Nelson's t test of each LS-mean against an average of the LS-means

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: performs no adjustment for multiple comparisons.

arguments.name: T
arguments.description: performs no adjustment for multiple comparisons.

arguments.name: SCHEFFE
arguments.description: performs Scheffe's multiple comparison procedure.

arguments.name: SIDAK
arguments.description: performs pairwise t tests on differences between LS-means with levels adjusted according to Sidak's inequality.

arguments.name: SIMULATE
arguments.description: performs the simulation-based multiple comparison procedure.

arguments.name: CVADJUST
arguments.description: estimates the quantile by the control variate adjustment method

arguments.name: EPS=
arguments.description: specifies a 100 (1-ε) confidence interval for the true probability content of the estimated (1-α) quantile.

arguments.name: NSAMP=
arguments.description: specifies the sample size for the simulation.

arguments.name: REPORT
arguments.description: displays a report on the simulation

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: specifies an integer to be used to start the pseudorandom number generator for the simulation.

arguments.name: SMM
arguments.description: performs pairwise comparisons based on the studentized maximum modulus and Sidak's uncorrelated-t inequality

arguments.name: GT2
arguments.description: performs pairwise comparisons based on the studentized maximum modulus and Sidak's uncorrelated-t inequality

arguments.name: TUKEY
arguments.description: performs Tukey's studentized range test on LS-means.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Determines the confidence level

arguments.name: STEPDOWN
arguments.description: Adjusts multiple-comparison p-values further in a step-down fashion

arguments.name: MAXTIME=
arguments.description: specifies the time (in seconds) for TYPE=LOGICAL.

arguments.name: REPORT
arguments.description: specifies that a report on the step-down adjustment be displayed

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: use maximal logically consistent sequential subsets of equality hypotheses

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: sequential subsets are computed ignoring logical constraints.

arguments.name: ASC
arguments.description: Sorts LS-means in ascending order in results that you display by specifying the LINES option

arguments.name: CL
arguments.description: Constructs confidence limits for means and mean differences

arguments.name: CORR
arguments.description: Displays the correlation matrix of LS-means

arguments.name: COV
arguments.description: Displays the covariance matrix of LS-means

arguments.name: E
arguments.description: Prints the L matrix

arguments.name: LINES
arguments.description: Uses connecting lines to indicate nonsignificantly different subsets of LS-means

arguments.name: LINESTABLE
arguments.description: Displays the results of the LINES option as a table

arguments.name: MEANS
arguments.description: Prints the LS-means

arguments.name: PLOTS
arguments.description: Produces graphs of means and mean comparisons

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: requests the default plots

arguments.name: ANOMPLOT
arguments.description: requests an analysis-of-means display

arguments.name: BOXPLOT
arguments.description: produces box plots of the distribution of the least squares mean or least squares mean differences

arguments.name: ORIENTATION=
arguments.description: specifies the orientation of the boxes

arguments.name: NPANELPOS=
arguments.description: specifies how to break the series of box plots across multiple panels.

arguments.name: CONTROLPLOT
arguments.description: requests a display in which least squares means are visually compared against a reference level.

arguments.name: DIFFOGRAM
arguments.description: requests a display of all pairwise least squares mean differences and their significance.

arguments.name: ABS
arguments.description: all line segments are shown on the same side of the reference line.

arguments.name: NOABS
arguments.description: separates comparisons according to the sign of the difference.

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: marks the center point for each comparison

arguments.name: NOLINES
arguments.description: suppresses the display of the line segments that represent the confidence bounds for the differences of the least squares means

arguments.name: DISTPLOT
arguments.description: generates panels of histograms with a kernel density overlaid if the analysis has access to a set of posterior parameter estimates.

arguments.name: BOX
arguments.description: controls the display of a horizontal box plot

arguments.name: NOBOX
arguments.description: controls the display of a horizontal box plot

arguments.name: HIST
arguments.description: controls the display of the histogram

arguments.name: NOHIST
arguments.description: controls the display of the histogram

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: controls the display of a normal density estimate

arguments.name: NONORMAL
arguments.description: controls the display of a normal density estimate

arguments.name: KERNEL
arguments.description: controls the display of a kernel density estimate

arguments.name: NOKERNEL
arguments.description: controls the display of a kernel density estimate

arguments.name: NROWS=
arguments.description: specifies the highest number of rows in a panel.

arguments.name: NCOLS=
arguments.description: specifies the highest number of columns in a panel

arguments.name: UNPACK
arguments.description: unpacks the panel into separate graphics.

arguments.name: LINESPLOT
arguments.description: modifies the dimensions of the LS-means comparison plot that is produced by the LINES option.

arguments.name: HSCALE=
arguments.description: scales the default height of the plot

arguments.name: WSCALE=
arguments.description: scales the default width of the plot

arguments.name: MEANPLOT
arguments.description: requests displays of the least squares means.

arguments.name: ASCENDING
arguments.description: displays the least squares means in ascending order.

arguments.name: CL
arguments.description: displays upper and lower confidence limits

arguments.name: CLBAND
arguments.description: displays confidence limits as bands.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: displays the least squares means in descending order.

arguments.name: ILINK
arguments.description: requests that means be displayed on the inverse linked scale.

arguments.name: JOIN
arguments.description: connects the least squares means with lines.

arguments.name: CONNECT
arguments.description: connects the least squares means with lines.

arguments.name: SLICEBY=
arguments.description: specifies an effect by which to group the means in a single plot.

arguments.name: PLOTBY=
arguments.description: specifies an effect by which to break interaction plots into separate displays.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: requests that no plots be produced.

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: Specifies the seed for computations that depend on random numbers

arguments.name: EXP
arguments.description: Exponentiates and displays estimates of LS-means or LS-means differences

arguments.name: ILINK
arguments.description: Computes and displays estimates and standard errors of LS-means (but not differences) on the inverse linked scale

arguments.name: ODDSRATIO
arguments.description: Reports (simple) differences of least squares means in terms of odds ratios if permitted by the link function

statements.name: STORE
statements.description: saves the context and results of the statistical analysis

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Specifies a one- or two-level SAS name for the store

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: Adds the label to the PROC PLM output

statements.name: STRATA
statements.description: names the variables that define strata or matched sets to use in stratified logistic regression of binary response data

arguments.name: CHECKDEPENDENCY=
arguments.description: specifies which variables are to be tested for dependency before the analysis is performed

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: performs no dependence checking.

arguments.name: COVARIATES
arguments.description: checks dependence between covariates and an added intercept.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: checks dependence between all the strata and covariates.

arguments.name: NOSUMMARY
arguments.description: suppresses the display of the "Strata Summary" table

arguments.name: INFO
arguments.description: displays the "Strata Information" table, which includes the stratum number, levels of the STRATA variables that define the stratum, the number of events, the number of non-events, and the total frequency for each stratum

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: treats missing values ('.', ._, .A,..., .Z for numeric variables and blanks for character variables) as valid STRATA variable values

statements.name: TEST
statements.description: tests linear hypotheses about the regression coefficients
statements.help: <*label*:>TEST  equation1 <, equation2,...></ option>;                                              *equation* is *term*<± term ...><=±*term*<±*term*...>>*term* is a parameter of the model, or a constant, or a constant times a parameter

arguments.name: PRINT
arguments.description: displays intermediate calculations in the testing of the null hypothesis

statements.name: UNITS
statements.description: enables you to specify units of change for the continuous explanatory variables so that customized odds ratios can be estimated

arguments.name: DEFAULT=
arguments.description: gives a list of units of change for all explanatory variables that are not specified in the UNITS statement

statements.name: WEIGHT
statements.description: weights each observation in the input data set by the value of the WEIGHT variable

arguments.name: NORMALIZE
arguments.description: causes the weights specified by the WEIGHT variable to be normalized so that they add up to the actual sample size
